column4: Hi. Is ubuntu easier to install for newer users? I am having several problems with debian, and no one will guide me to fix them. I tried Ubuntu but was having problems with the installer. If I explain the problem can someone try and tell me what to do?
okeys. Gimme a sec. going to load up the disk.

Okay, this is stupid. Now that I installed a bad version of Debian, I have GRUB, and it doesnt check to see if CD-Rom will be bootable. Itj ust goes straight to GRUB and its annoying the crap out of me. Can anyone help? I just need to uninstall GRUB or Debian atleast. I am a complete newbie to linux just trying to test it out on a different comp.
that has nothing to do with grub
thats a bios setting
it still has nothing to do with grub
it means either your cdrom is bad, or your cdrom is not recognized properly
grub only gives you the debian options ONCE THE BIOS HAS DECIDED TO BOOT FROM THE HD
we don't like repeating our selves, primarily because we don't go out of our way to lie to you
yes, its a bios/hardware/cdrom issue, grub only comes in to give youd ebian ONLY options ONCE THE BIOS BRINGS UP THE HD
BECAUSE YOUR CDROM ISN'T BEING RECOGNIZED, YOUR CD IS BAD, YOUR CDROM IDE CABLE IS FAULTY
check yoru cdrom jumper settings, try anoter ide cable
lots of things can go wrong to trick the bios into not 'seeing' your cdrom of boot partition on the cd it self
what kind of hardware do you have on your machine?
i've had one debian install fail for someone in the netherlands on some obscure scsi/mobo related issues
no scsi hardware?
scsi hard drive as opposed to ide hard drive, usually its faster, smaller, noisier and more reliable
just curious, how did you get it to boot of cdrom?
I flipped the ide cable around to have CDDrive on the end, and HDD in the middle.
heh, i've had similar situation
if you select the desktop configuration yes
